Package com.intellij.openapi.vcs

Class VcsRootChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.vcs.VcsRootChecker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultVcsRootChecker, GitRootChecker, HgRootChecker

    public abstract class VcsRootChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods to check if the given directory is a root of the given VCS. This is used e.g. by the VcsRootDetector to detect invalid roots (registered in the settings, but not related to real VCS roots on disk) and unregistered roots (real roots on disk not registered in the settings).

    • Method Detail

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot(java.lang.String path)
        Checks if the given path represents a root of the supported VCS.

      • validateRoot

        public boolean validateRoot(java.lang.String path)
        Checks if registered mapping can be used to perform VCS operations. The difference with isRoot(java.lang.String) is that this method should return true if unsure.

      • getSupportedVcs

        public abstract VcsKey getSupportedVcs()
        Returns the VCS supported by this checker.

      • isVcsDir

        public boolean isVcsDir(java.lang.String dirName)
        Checks if the given directory looks like a VCS special directory, e.g. ".git".

        This is a quick rough check. A more precise is done in isRoot(String).

      • isIgnored

        public boolean isIgnored(VirtualFile root,
                         VirtualFile checkForIgnore)
        Check if the given directory is ignored in the given VCS root. Such situation can happen, when we detect a VCS root above the directory: in that case we should detect the root only if the directory is not ignored from that root (e.g. the root is the home directory, and the VCS is used for storing configs, ignoring everything else).

      • areChildrenValidMappings

        public boolean areChildrenValidMappings()
        Returns:
        Whether any descendant of VCS root can be registered as valid VCS mapping.
